security: Sharing information about the interview process and the specific questions asked could potentially reveal intelligence-gathering methods.
summary: An interview with Epifanio Romero-Delgado, a Cuban pre-inductee residing in Miami, Florida, conducted on January 21, 1963, regarding his arrest in Cuba for suspected anti-Castro activities.
summary_one_paragraph: On January 21, 1963, Armando C. Pisano conducted an interview with Epifanio Romero-Delgado, a Cuban pre-inductee living in Miami, Florida, concerning his arrest in Cuba on April 20, 1961. Romero-Delgado stated he was arrested by the G-2 in Finca de la Mar, San Cristobal, Pinar del Rio, on suspicion of working with anti-Castro elements due to his associations. He was held for five days, interrogated without food or water, and then sent to jail in Consolacion del Sur for 13 days before being released without trial due to lack of evidence; he affirmed this was his only arrest.
title: SUBJECT INTERVIEW
locations_mentioned: Finca de la Mar, San Cristobal, Pinar del Rio, Cuba
Consolacion del Sur, Pinar del Rio, Cuba
